noun.description: A woman who has lost her spouse by death and has not remarried.
A last word or short last line of a paragraph falling at the top of a page or column and considered undesirable.

verb.description: Make into a widow or widower.
examples: she had to care for her widowed mother

origin: Old English widewe, from an Indo-European root meaning be empty; compare with Sanskrit vidh be destitute, Latin viduus bereft, widowed, and Greek ēitheos unmarried man.
